str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) To lead, (b) To think, be of opinion, suppose, consider.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Damage, loss, detriment. Probably akin to the base of damazo; detriment.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To excel, surpass, be superior. From huper and echo; to hold oneself above, i.e. to excel; participle superior, superiority.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Knowledge, doctrine, wisdom. From ginosko; knowing, i.e. knowledge.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: From zemia; to injure, i.e. to experience detriment.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) To lead, (b) To think, be of opinion, suppose, consider.
Refuse, dregs, dung. Neuter of a presumed derivative of eis and kuon and ballo; what is thrown to the dogs, i.e. Refuse.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To gain, acquire, win (over), avoid loss. From kerdos; to gain.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
